intro: Mesembryanthemum bidentatum, commonly known as the two-toothed iceplant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that open in response to light. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with bluish-green leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters and blooming during the cooler months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems to survive dry conditions.
